# Un-tidy cakes

```{r echo = FALSE}
cakes_untidy <- read_csv(here::here("data", "tidy-gbbo-cakes.csv"), col_types = cols(series = col_factor(levels = NULL))) %>% 
  count(series, challenge, cake) %>% 
  drop_na(cake) %>% 
  rename(bakes = n) %>% 
  spread(cake, bakes, fill = 0) 

cakes_split <- cakes_untidy %>% 
  split(.$series) 
```


.pull-left[
```{r echo = FALSE}
cakes_split[[1]]
cakes_split[[2]]
```
]

--


.pull-right[
```{r echo = FALSE}
cakes_split[[3]]
cakes_split[[4]]
```
]

---

# Still un-tidy cakes


```{r}
cakes_untidy %>% 
  bind_rows()
```


---

# Finally tidy cakes

```{r}
cakes_tidy <- cakes_untidy %>% 
  gather(bake_type, num_bakes, cake:pie_tart, 
         factor_key = TRUE) %>% 
  arrange(series)
cakes_tidy
```

---
class: middle, inverse, center

## Know Your Tidy Data

```{r}
glimpse(cakes_tidy)
```


---

```{r}
library(skimr)

skim(cakes_tidy) %>% 
  summary() 
```

## Benefits of Tidy Data


---


```{r}
cakes_tidy %>% 
  count(challenge, bake_type, wt = num_bakes, sort = TRUE)
```

---


```{r}
cakes_tidy %>% 
  count(series, bake_type, wt = num_bakes)
```

---

```{r}
library(skimr)
cakes_tidy %>% 
  group_by(bake_type) %>% 
  select_if(is.numeric) %>% 
  skim()
```

See: https://suzanbaert.netlify.com/2018/01/dplyr-tutorial-1/

---


```{r}
cakes_by_series <- cakes_tidy %>% 
  count(series, bake_type, wt = num_bakes) 
cakes_by_series
```

---


```{r fig.height = 3, fig.width = 4}
ggplot(cakes_by_series, aes(x = series, y = n, 
                            color = bake_type,
                            group = bake_type)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_line() +
  expand_limits(y = 0)
```
